title: How to Grow Lamb's Lettuce (Mache, Corn Salad)

steps.headline: Grow from seed into seedlings or purchase seedlings.
steps.description: The best growing season is autumn, winter, and early spring, making these ideal winter salad vegetables.

steps.headline: Plant in a wide, shallow container.
steps.description: Purchase a container that has space for a dozen or more plants. That is the amount required for a small salad.

steps.headline: Add fertile potting soil to the container.
steps.description: Add the seeds or seedlings. Keep the container in full sun and keep constantly moist. A windowsill is an ideal place for it.

steps.headline: Pick the leaves every few days.
steps.description: Once the plant is about 10 centimeter (3.9 in) in size, pick two to three leaves from each plant daily.

steps.headline: Add a fertiliser every two weeks.
Sow new batches every two to four weeks so that you have a regular supply.

text: Grow from seed into seedlings or purchase seedlings. The best growing season is autumn, winter, and early spring, making these ideal winter salad vegetables. Plant in a wide, shallow container. Purchase a container that has space for a dozen or more plants. That is the amount required for a small salad. Add fertile potting soil to the container. Add the seeds or seedlings. Keep the container in full sun and keep constantly moist. A windowsill is an ideal place for it. Pick the leaves every few days. Once the plant is about 10 centimeter (3.9 in) in size, pick two to three leaves from each plant daily. Add a fertiliser every two weeks. Use a liquid Fertilizer. Sow new batches every two to four weeks so that you have a regular supply.
